intro: Tetragonanthus paucifolius, commonly known as the sparse-leaved tetragonanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
